ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] soft-404 detection
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, Nice work. In case it helps, I already transliterated then SSDeep C algorithm into Java, here:

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] soft-404 detection
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=527405791; y=jcPkKt957L_oaC2NbW2T4A1wZYrI44HhmEhqNm4BTNZsI-2g4CKbxvyHOy13LHCC8frCFxiiJXqyZg0

Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset=utf-8

Hi,

Nice work.

In case it helps, I already transliterated then SSDeep C a=
lgorithm into Java, here: https://github.com/openpreserve/bitwiser/blob/mas=
ter/bitwiser-core/src/main/java/eu/scape_project/bitwiser/utils/SSDeep.java=
 <https://github.com/openpreserve/bitwiser/blob/master/bitwiser-core/src/ma=
in/java/eu/scape_project/bitwiser/utils/SSDeep.java>

Certainly, it seems l=
ike it might be useful to extend H3 to try a random URL on each host (perha=
ps as a prerequisite?), so that the data is there for later processing.  It=
=E2=80=99s not clear to me whether we would want to reclassify the bad-200s=
 as soft-404s during the crawl and in the WARCs, i.e. whether we need to ac=
t on this information immediately or just make sure we have what we need fo=
r post-crawl analysis.

Andy Jackson


> On 11 Feb 2015, at 07:56, Rene Voo=
rburg voorburg@... <mailto:voorburg@...> [archive-crawler] <arc=
hive-crawler@yahoogroups.com <mailto:archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com>> wrot=
e:
> 
> Hi,
> 
> 
> For robustify.js (https://github.com/renevoorburg/robus=
tify.js <https://github.com/renevoorburg/robustify.js>) I've been working o=
n soft-404 detection. I think Heritrix  (and the chain following it) would =
greatly benefit from having such functionality. The approach taken in the r=
obustify.js statuscode.php script seems to work pretty well (but to test it=
 well I need a set of soft-404s and that would require some good soft-404 d=
etection, a typical chicken - egg situation).
> 
> It would be beneficial t=
o detect soft-404s because:
> - essential they are 404s so knowing soft-404=
s helps to quantify and understand the web
> - knowing soft 404s can help i=
mprove functionality of search indexes
> - soft-404s might be the source of=
 crawler traps, so we probably will not want to use them to detect new urls=

> - in some cases we might not even want to store soft 404s, which helps k=
eeping the archive smaller
> - ...
> 
> Having soft-404 detection will pose=
 some questions. For example, how to mark a soft-404 in a warc file? Do we =
simply overwrite the statuscode? Perhaps it is better to store it in the ot=
her metadata parts. I have no idea how to do that in a warc. Further, do we=
 want to store the random request we need to be able to detect the soft 404=
 (using fuzzy hash matching)? How do we mark this request in the warc (of d=
on't we even record it?). Probably it is also handy to store the similarity=
 between the soft 404 pages and the and the random request. The required le=
vel of similarity should probably be configurable.
> 
> If only I was more =
fluent in Java I would give implementing this a try. Essentially it is a pr=
etty simple algorithm. 
> 
> Looking forward to your thoughts and ideas.
> =

> Ren=C3=A9 Voorburg
> 
> 
> 
> 


--Apple-Mail=_66D2DECD-68EB-4BD3-B40C-981E42282675
